tasks.title: Project Setup and Design System Implementation
tasks.description: Initialize the project repository, set up file structure, and implement the design system based on Yanolja Group's guidelines.
tasks.details:
1. Create GitHub repository
2. Set up basic file structure (index.html, css/, js/, assets/)
3. Initialize package.json
4. Create CSS variables for the design system:
   - Colors: Primary (#FF385C), Secondary (#00D9FF), Accent (#A855F7), Dark (#0F0F23, #1A1A2E, #16213E), Light (#FFFFFF), Gray Scale (#F7F7F7 ~ #171717)
   - Typography: Import Inter and Noto Sans KR from Google Fonts
   - Spacing system: 8px base (0.5rem ~ 8rem)
   - Border radius: Small (6px), Medium (8px), Large (12px), XL (16px), 2XL (24px), Full (9999px)
5. Create global CSS reset and base styles
6. Set up meta tags for SEO and responsive design
tasks.testStrategy: Verify CSS variables are correctly implemented by testing them in browser dev tools. Ensure file structure follows best practices. Validate HTML with W3C validator. Test meta tags for proper viewport settings.

tasks.title: Navigation Bar Implementation
tasks.description: Create a fixed navigation bar with auto-hide/show on scroll, mobile hamburger menu, smooth scrolling, and active section highlighting.
tasks.details:
1. Create HTML structure for navigation with links to all sections
2. Style navigation bar using CSS flexbox
3. Implement fixed positioning with transition for hide/show
4. Create hamburger menu for mobile view using CSS and JavaScript
5. Implement JavaScript for:
   - Detecting scroll position
   - Hiding/showing navigation based on scroll direction
   - Highlighting active section based on scroll position
   - Smooth scrolling to sections when links are clicked
6. Ensure responsive design for all screen sizes
7. Add appropriate ARIA attributes for accessibility
tasks.testStrategy: Test navigation on all device sizes. Verify smooth scrolling works correctly. Check that active section highlighting updates properly. Test keyboard navigation for accessibility. Verify hamburger menu functions correctly on mobile.

tasks.title: Hero Section Development
tasks.description: Create a fullscreen hero section with large typography, gradient text effects, CTA buttons, scroll indicator animation, and background gradient animation.
tasks.testStrategy: Test hero section on all device sizes. Verify animations work correctly in different browsers. Check that CTA buttons are properly styled and positioned. Ensure text is readable on all backgrounds. Test scroll indicator functionality.

tasks.title: About Section Implementation
tasks.description: Develop the About section with designer introduction text, statistics counter animation, 2-column grid layout, and scroll animations.
tasks.testStrategy: Test counter animations to ensure they trigger correctly on scroll. Verify grid layout responds appropriately on different screen sizes. Check that AOS animations work as expected. Ensure text is readable and properly formatted.

tasks.title: Services Section Development
tasks.description: Create the Services section with 3 service cards (UI/UX Design, Web Design, Branding), card hover effects, and responsive grid layout.
tasks.testStrategy: Test hover effects on different devices. Verify grid layout responds correctly on all screen sizes. Check that icons and text are properly aligned. Ensure AOS animations trigger correctly. Test keyboard focus states for accessibility.

tasks.title: Portfolio Section Implementation
tasks.description: Develop the Portfolio section with project grid layout, image overlay effects, hover information display, image zoom animations, and at least 3 projects.
tasks.testStrategy: Test hover effects on different devices. Verify grid layout responds correctly on all screen sizes. Check that overlay information is readable. Test lazy loading functionality. Ensure images load properly and maintain aspect ratios.

tasks.title: Achievements Section Development
tasks.description: Create the Achievements section with 4 achievement cards, number counter animations, and responsive grid layout.
tasks.testStrategy: Test counter animations to ensure they trigger correctly on scroll. Verify grid layout responds appropriately on different screen sizes. Check that AOS animations work as expected. Ensure text is readable and properly formatted.

tasks.title: Contact Section Implementation
tasks.description: Develop the Contact section with 2-column layout (contact information + inquiry form), form validation, and submit button.
tasks.testStrategy: Test form validation with various inputs (empty fields, invalid email, etc.). Verify error messages display correctly. Check form layout on different screen sizes. Test form submission and reset functionality. Ensure form is accessible with keyboard navigation.

tasks.title: AOS Library Integration
tasks.description: Integrate and configure the Animate On Scroll (AOS) library for scroll-based animations throughout the website.
tasks.details:
1. Include AOS library via CDN or download and include locally 2. Initialize AOS in JavaScript 3. Add appropriate AOS attributes to elements throughout the site 4. Configure global AOS settings (duration, easing, offset) 5. Test and fine-tune animations HTML for AOS integration: ```html ``` Example of AOS attributes in HTML: ```html
This will fade up with a delay
This will fade from left with custom duration
```
tasks.testStrategy: Test animations on different devices and screen sizes. Verify animations trigger at appropriate scroll positions. Check for any performance issues. Ensure animations enhance rather than detract from user experience. Test with reduced motion preferences enabled.

tasks.title: Advanced Animation Effects Implementation
tasks.description: Implement advanced animation effects including card tilt effects, magnetic button effects, and scroll progress indicator.
tasks.testStrategy: Test magnetic button effect on different devices. Verify scroll progress indicator updates correctly. Check card tilt effect for smoothness and performance. Ensure animations work across different browsers. Test with reduced motion preferences enabled.

tasks.title: Responsive Design Implementation
tasks.description: Ensure the website is fully responsive across all device sizes (Desktop: 1280px+, Tablet: 768px-1024px, Mobile: <768px).
tasks.testStrategy: Test on actual devices (phones, tablets, desktops) when possible. Use browser dev tools to test various screen sizes. Check for layout issues, text overflow, and improper spacing. Verify touch targets are appropriately sized on mobile. Test with different orientations (portrait/landscape).

tasks.title: Performance Optimization
tasks.description: Optimize website performance to meet requirements (initial loading time <3s, lazy loading for images, CSS/JS optimization).
tasks.testStrategy: Use Google PageSpeed Insights to measure performance. Test loading time on various network conditions. Verify lazy loading works correctly. Check for render-blocking resources. Measure and optimize Largest Contentful Paint (LCP), First Input Delay (FID), and Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS).

tasks.title: Accessibility Implementation
tasks.description: Ensure the website meets WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards with proper semantic HTML, ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and color contrast.
tasks.testStrategy: Use accessibility audit tools (Lighthouse, axe). Test keyboard navigation throughout the site. Check screen reader compatibility. Verify color contrast meets WCAG AA standards. Test with browser extensions that simulate various disabilities. Ensure all interactive elements have appropriate focus states.

tasks.title: Cross-Browser Testing
tasks.description: Test the website across all major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) to ensure consistent functionality and appearance.
tasks.details:
1. Test on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge
2. Check for layout inconsistencies
3. Verify all animations and interactions work
4. Test form functionality
5. Check for CSS compatibility issues
6. Fix any browser-specific bugs

Common issues to look for:
- Flexbox/Grid support differences
- CSS variable support
- Animation performance
- Form styling differences
- Font rendering differences
tasks.testStrategy: Create a testing matrix with browsers and features to test. Use browser developer tools to identify and fix issues. Test on actual devices when possible. Use BrowserStack or similar services for comprehensive testing. Document and address any browser-specific issues.

tasks.title: Deployment to GitHub Pages
tasks.description: Deploy the completed website to GitHub Pages for public access and testing.
tasks.details:
1. Ensure all files are properly committed to the repository
2. Configure GitHub Pages in repository settings
3. Set up custom domain if needed
4. Verify deployed site functionality
5. Add README.md with project information

Steps for GitHub Pages deployment:
```
1. Go to repository Settings
2. Navigate to Pages section
3. Select main branch as source
4. Save settings
5. Wait for deployment to complete
6. Access site at https://[username].github.io/[repository-name]/
```

README.md template:
```markdown

tasks.testStrategy: Test the deployed site on various devices and browsers. Verify all links work correctly with the deployed URL. Check that assets (images, CSS, JS) load properly. Test form submission on the live site. Verify performance metrics match local development.
